Job DescriptionBackgroundDiversity, Equity and Inclusion are core principles at UNDP: we value diversity as an expression of the multiplicity of nations and cultures where we operate, we foster inclusion as a way of ensuring all personnel are empowered to contribute to our mission, and we ensure equity and fairness in all our actions. Taking a ‘leave no one behind’ approach to our diversity efforts means increasing representation of underserved populations. People who identify as belonging to marginalized or excluded populations are strongly encouraged to apply. Learn more about working at UNDP including our values and inspiring stories.UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.Under the current Country Programme Document cycle, UNDP Pakistan is committed to support gender equality and women's empowerment in line with UNDP Gender Equality Strategy 2022 - 2025, and the Gender Action Plan of the UNDP Pakistan Country Office, through integrating gender equality and women’s empowerment (GEWE) into all aspects of UNDP's work while working on eliminating poverty and building resilience of communities.UNDP Pakistan is recruiting a Gender Analyst to help ensure an adequate impact of gender mainstreaming throughout the country programme and consolidate an enabling environment for institutional effectiveness to deliver gender-responsive and sustainable results, as well as to assist the Country Office meet the expected benchmarks to receive the UNDP Gender Seal Gold Certification.The Gender Analyst will work closely with all programme and project teams and relevant stakeholders within the UNDP system, in the identification, design, and support implementation of critical gender interventions for UNDP Pakistan, while maintaining a strong contribution to resource mobilization. Additionally, the position will also require extensive engagement, networking, and partnership building with international and national partners, including other UN agencies, government counterparts, civil society, and non-governmental organizations, women’s organizations and networks, bilateral and multilateral donors, women syndicates, and private sector actors.Job PurposeThe Gender Analyst will work to support the holistic approach to strengthening gender in the office. This involves the direct targeting of gender in programming through the design and implementation of projects and initiatives that are gender specific while also mainstreaming gender in all other projects, office operations and management, partner engagement and communications. Gender mainstreaming will cover projects, office operations, partner engagement and communications of the office.The Gender Analyst is expected to provide strategic and technical support to programme and project teams on all interventions, particularly those that are focused on gender equality and women’s empowerment, lead and coordinate advocacy and partnership building efforts, support resource mobilization for gender mainstreaming, and to facilitate knowledge building, management, and sharing across all UNDP programmes and projects, and to provide advice and lead the coordination of the Gender Seal process,. The incumbent will also support the Gender Focal Team and build capacity of the Gender Focal Teams on Gender Analysis, Gender Marker, and Gender Seal implementation, including SHSEA prevention and response.Duties And ResponsibilitiesSupport to gender equality programming and gender integration within the office Provide overall strategic direction on the implementation of gender within the context of the country programme document.Support management, programme, operations, and project staff on the implementation of the UNDP Gender Equality StrategyOversee the development of the gender activities under country office pillar’s portfolio and ensure synergies and maximize the results. Ensure continuous liaison with implementing partners on the progress of gender work in close collaboration with pillar team leaders and project managers.
Partnership and Resource Mobilization Support identification and facilitation of strategic partnership building opportunities for gender equality.Analysis and research of information on donors, preparation of substantive briefs on possible areas of cooperation, identification of opportunities for initiation of new projects, active contribution to the overall office effort in resource mobilization.Develop and implement gender resource mobilization plan to advance gender responsive programming with the support of senior management
Ensuring Gender Equality Mainstreaming in Programmes and Operations Conduct gender analysis to inform the design of new programmes and ensure gender equality integration in newly developed concept notes and proposals. Integrate gender equality in the country office programme/projects’ annual plans including planning for expenditures, activities, partnerships, resources, capacities, communication, and learning.Conduct gender review on an annual basis to assess the overall country office performance, and document recommendations and lessons learned. Ensure gender equality is integrated in seniors' and team leaders' performance management goals. Plan and coordinate with the HR and staff association initiatives that promote an enabling environment for women and men to perform equally. Update the gender parity analysis/strategy and ensure gender equality consideration within human resources and procurement processes.
Monitoring & Evaluation, and Learning In collaboration with CO M&E and RBM focal points, oversee the development of gender transformative indicators for the newly formulated initiatives; Support effective application of gender mainstreaming throughout the Country office programme and project cycle, monitoring and evaluation frameworks, communication and advocacy, results reporting and quality assurance of results.Support the design and implementation of the anticipated impact/independent evaluation to capture gender contribution and results by including relevant baselines; Conceptualize trainings for UNDP staff and implementing partners to build capacity on designing of gender related monitoring and evaluation plans and activities.
Support to gender equality programming and gender integration within the office Provide overall strategic direction on the implementation of gender within the context of the country programme document.Support management, programme, operations, and project staff on the implementation of the UNDP Gender Equality StrategyOversee the development of the gender activities under country office pillar’s portfolio and ensure synergies and maximize the results. Ensure continuous liaison with implementing partners on the progress of gender work in close collaboration with pillar team leaders and project managers.
The incumbent of the position should avoid any kind of discriminatory behavior including gender discrimination and ensure that:  Human rights and gender equality is prioritized as an ethical principle within all actions;Activities are designed and implemented in accordance with “Social and Environmental Standards of UNDP”;Any kind of diversities based on ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, disability, religion, class, gender are respected within all implementations including data production;Differentiated needs of women and men are considered;Inclusive approach is reflected within all actions and implementations, in that sense an enabling and accessible setup in various senses such as disability gender language barrier is created;Necessary arrangements to ensure gender parity within all committees, meetings, trainings etc. introduced. The incumbent performs other duties within their functional profile as deemed necessary for the efficient functioning of the Office and the Organization.
CompetenciesCore Achieve Results: LEVEL 1: Plans and monitors own work, pays attention to details, delivers quality work by deadlineThink Innovatively: LEVEL 1: Open to creative ideas/known risks, is pragmatic problem solver, makes improvementsLearn Continuously: LEVEL 1: Open minded and curious, shares knowledge, learns from mistakes, asks for feedbackAdapt with Agility: LEVEL 1: Adapts to change, constructively handles ambiguity/uncertainty, is flexibleAct with Determination: LEVEL 1: Shows drive and motivation, able to deliver calmly in face of adversity, confidentEngage and Partner: LEVEL 1: Demonstrates compassion/understanding towards others, forms positive relationshipsEnable Diversity and Inclusion: LEVEL 1: Appreciate/respect differences, aware of unconscious bias, confront discrimination 
Business direction and strategy: System Thinking:  Ability to use objective problem analysis and judgement to understand how interrelated elements coexist within an overall process or system, and to consider how altering one element ca impact on other parts of the system.
Business development: Knowledge Generation: Ability to research and turn information into useful knowledge, relevant for context, or responsive to a stated need.
Business development: Knowledge Facilitation: Ability to animate individuals and communities of contributors to participate and share, particularly externally.
Business management: Partnership Management: Ability to build and maintain partnerships with wide networks o stakeholders, Governments, civil society and private sector partners, experts, and others in line with UNDP strategy and policies
Business management: Communication:  Ability to communicate in a clear, concise, and unambiguous manner both through written and verbal communication; to tail messages and choose communication methods depending on the audienceAbility to manage communications internally and externally, through media, social media and other appropriate channels
Business Management: Portfolio Management:  Ability to select, prioritize and control the organization’s programmes and projects, in line with its strategic objectives and capacity; ability to balance the implementation of change initiatives and the maintenance of business-as-usual, while optimizing return on investment

EducationRequired Skills and Experience Advanced university degree (Master's degree or equivalent), preferably in international development, international affairs, social and/or public policy, economics, or a related field is required , ORA first-level university degree (bachelor’s degree) in the areas mentioned above in combination with an additional two years of qualifying experience will be given due consideration in lieu of the advanced university degree.

About the job
            

 
About DarazFounded in 2015, Daraz is South Asia’s leading e-commerce platform in Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal and Myanmar. It empowers more than 100,000 active sellers with world-class marketplace technology to reach the fast-growing consumer class in a region of 500 million people. Through Daraz Express and Daraz Pay, it operates the most efficient and digitalized logistics and payments infrastructure in its markets. Daraz’ vision is to be a champion of South Asia serving 100 million customers and businesses by 2030.For more information, please visit www.daraz.comCustomer Experience (CXP) is part of the Daraz core identity and has been strategic focus since our inception. Our CXP mission is “to boost customer loyalty through a seamless and personalised experience, equally for our buyers and our sellers.” As a Regional Customer Insights (Voice of Customer) Manager - CXP, you will be an integral part of Daraz efforts towards offering the best experience to our customers and you are at the forefront of driving efforts with respect to our mission. The CXP team is segregated into a regional team as well as different country teams in Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal and Myanmar.In Daraz, we believe that great customer experiences are grounded by a deep understanding of our customer's true needs and motivations. The Customer Insights team is responsible for identifying the customer needs and pain points through comprehensive data analysis and additional insights studies. We are looking for a skilled candidate who is able to connect the dots from multiple data sources and CX metrics to direct primary design research activities in order to improve the overall customer experience.Job Description Champion: customer experience and help strengthening customer experience mindset across the entire company by providing the right insights and establish the right cross-functional routines to uplift customer loyaltyEstablish: customer insights function within the regional team as well as within our various country organisations, working with the country CCOs by helping to acquire top talent, or nurturing and retaining high potential individuals in the current teams related to this new Customer Insights functionDrive: performance through strong data analytics, delivering insights and status updates on buyer & seller satisfactionConduct: experience (NPS / PSAT) root cause and trending analysis to identify reasons for underperformance and propose actionable recommendations while escalating any risks from emerging trends which are buyer, seller and business impactingExecute: research (quantitative / qualitative) and create insights-driven presentations with recommendations to senior management and stakeholdersCollaborate: with different business units to frame and identify customer insights and derive joint plans to act on it in order to improve key business metricsGrow: to help the business get better, every day, 1% at the time, ensuring we offer best-in-class experience. You review industry best practices and benchmarks to ensure that Daraz remains competitive and maintains market leadership across all marketsEnhance: performance by supporting to set clear KPIs and measuring against these on a regular basis to manage team performanceDo: and figure out how to get from A to B – and actually make it happen – at Daraz, we are big fans of leading by example, pulling up your sleeves and getting things done
A bit about you Experience: 2+ years experience in project management, consulting, business development, market research and/or customer experience related role;Researcher: minimum Bachelor’s degree in business, Economics, Statistics, Psychology or other quantitative / qualitative research related degree is desirable;Self-starter: you have a bias towards action and are able to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing work environment;Problem solver: you have a talent for synthesising complex projects, can independently translate high-level goals into actionable plans, and enjoy implementing processes;Owner: you crave responsibility and want to help shaping the vision and direction of the company;Adaptable: you are able to deal and thrive in high ambiguity environments that are continuously evolving and changing;Analytical: you are extremely diligent and have a strong tendency to make data-driven decisions, proficient in Google Sheets / MS Excel and familiarity with analytical tools (experience using SQL is desirable);Approachable: you are down to earth, humble, and hence are able to work with Darazians across all seniority levels;
What we offer International working environment in a start-up setting, and a unique opportunity to learn from the best in e-commerce (Alibaba Group) and business growth.A platform to learn from Alibaba’s world-leading ecosystemRigorous training and exposure in team management, leadership, business analytics, and operations.An opportunity to train the next generation of business leaders in the ‘tech’ industry.Competitive salary and incentive package

Who are we? RadiusXR is dedicated to enhancing opportunities for patients, physicians, and staff by providing cutting-edge vision testing capabilities that replace traditional methods. Our portable vision diagnostic and patient engagement system, integrated into a proprietary, wearable XR headset, combines medical-grade diagnostics with business management and patient education tools. RadiusXR was founded by the same team behind IrisVision, a life-changing solution for individuals with legal blindness and low-vision conditions. Join us in revolutionizing healthcare and improving patient care through innovative technology.   Summary: We are looking for a talented and experienced Senior Soft Engineer and an EHR Integration Specialist to join our engineering team at RadiusXR. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in our mission to enhance healthcare delivery by seamlessly integrating Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems with our cutting-edge healthcare solutions. This crucial role requires expertise in healthcare software development, data communication protocols, and a deep understanding of integration best practices. You will work closely with product and engineering teams to ensure that our middleware solutions align with our product strategy and customer requirements. Your expertise will be instrumental in developing an accelerated integration strategy, creating an integration roadmap, prioritizing integrations based on complexity vs. value, and executing integration plans. This pivotal role will require close collaboration with our Product team to ensure the seamless delivery of integrated healthcare solutions to our clients. In this role, your primary responsibilities will include designing, developing, and maintaining middleware solutions that facilitate communication between our proprietary software system and third-party EHR systems, driving integration implementations with the EHR systems, and maintaining / supporting existing integrations. Your secondary responsibility will be to manage and maintain the EHR product roadmap with the product team.  Responsibilities:  Middleware Solution Development: Design, develop, and rigorously test middleware solutions that facilitate robust communication between our proprietary software system and third-party EHR systems. Data Communication Protocols: Implement and optimize data communication protocols such as HL7, FHIR, and DICOM to ensure efficient and accurate data exchange. Data Security and Privacy: Implement robust encryption and access controls within the middleware solutions to guarantee data privacy and security. Product Strategy Alignment: Collaborate closely with our product and engineering teams to ensure that middleware solutions seamlessly integrate with our overarching product strategy. Customer Collaboration: Engage with our customers to understand their specific integration needs and craft middleware solutions that cater to their requirements. Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution: Actively troubleshoot and resolve middleware-related issues to maintain the integrity of integrations. Stay Current with Technology Trends: Continuously monitor and adapt to the latest middleware technologies and trends, keeping our solutions cutting-edge. 
 Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field. Experience in integrating with US EHR systems. A minimum of 5 years of software development experience, showcasing a strong programming background.  Proven track record of at least 2 years in designing and building middleware solutions. Extensive experience in healthcare software development. Proficiency in programming languages like JavaScript, Java, C#, or Python. Strong familiarity with data communication protocols, including HL7, FHIR, and DICOM. Desirable experience with middleware platforms, integration engines, or healthcare interoperability solutions.  Experience with cloud computing platforms, such as AWS or Azure. Proficiency in DevOps practices to ensure seamless integration and deployment. Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills. Excellent communication and teamwork abilities, with the capacity to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. 
 We’re a passionate team who believe in ownership, excellence, and creating technology that helps people improve their quality of life. If you thrive on solving challenging problems with a fun group of bright people, we want to hear from you!

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we see generative AI as more than a trend; we consider it the future scaffold of efficient software engineering. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and cloud computing once were. If you're a seasoned software engineer with a keen interest in AI technologies, this role offers you a unique opportunity to blend your skills in both domains.Unlike many companies that only scratch the surface of AI's potential, Trilogy places a strong emphasis on the practical integration of generative AI into our engineering processes. Our methods aim for quick and tangible results, focusing on reusing and fine-tuning existing AI models to improve engineering outcomes.The primary responsibility in this position would be to develop a framework that effectively leverages AI tools within our engineering process. You'll propose and conduct experiments with generative AI to optimize problem-solving, solution design, and code generation. Additionally, you'll document these best practices in playbooks that will serve as invaluable resources for other engineering teams.You will adopt, test, and aggressively integrate new technologies, ultimately standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity, allowing our engineers to concentrate on essential decision-making.If this sounds like the challenge you've been waiting for, apply now to be a part of our transformative journey!What You Will Be Doing Leading initiatives and experiments using generative AI to improve engineering processes such as code generation, problem decomposition, and troubleshootingDocumenting and continually refining guidelines that set the standard for how generative AI should be used in software engineeringTaking on the development of fully functional features, using AI tools to expedite delivery and enhance quality
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models; instead, you will focus on using and/or fine-tuning existing modelsBeing confined to outdated technologies or a static tech stack that hinders innovation
AI-Augmented Software Developer Key Responsibilities Establishing frameworks that integrate generative AI into our engineering processes to significantly boost productivity
Basic Requirements Minimum 5 years of experience in software developmentMinimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software productExtensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Chemonics seeks a Chief of Party (COP) for the anticipated five-year USAID She Leads, Pakistan Rises (SLPR) activity. Today, those products are part of huge markets, such as apparel, wall-art, drinkware, digitally printed books, greeting cards. In the future, the market opportunities are endless thanks to new technologies such as 3D printing. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs and the global shift towards local and more sustainable production.Gelato TechnologyWe own no physical production assets, nor servers, instead our asset is a cloud based connectivity platform that enables world-class on-demand production for e-commerce platforms and applications. This engineered platform needs to provide our customers access to more than 130 production partners in 32 countries and includes production plate design, routing to an appropriate partner, finally linking to logistics’ systems for delivery to the consumer. All this in 72 hours and reaching more than 5 billion people and potential consumers in a smarter, faster, and greener way.The employed technologies range from backends using PHP and GoLang to mobile apps built natively or with hybrid technology, running on cloud services and with a modern CI/CD pipeline. Designing highly-available, fault-tolerant, cost-effective, scalable systems is our passion. We are using TDD, BDD, DDD principles and patterns, and agile methodology. You'll propose and conduct experiments with generative AI to optimize problem-solving, solution design, and code generation. Additionally, you'll document these best practices in playbooks that will serve as invaluable resources for other engineering teams.You will adopt, test, and aggressively integrate new technologies, ultimately standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity, allowing our engineers to concentrate on essential decision-making.If this sounds like the challenge you've been waiting for, apply now to be a part of our transformative journey!What You Will Be Doing Leading initiatives and experiments using generative AI to improve engineering processes such as code generation, problem decomposition, and troubleshootingDocumenting and continually refining guidelines that set the standard for how generative AI should be used in software engineeringTaking on the development of fully functional features, using AI tools to expedite delivery and enhance quality

AI-Augmented Software Developer Key Responsibilities Establishing frameworks that integrate generative AI into our engineering processes to significantly boost productivity

Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Motive is one of the fastest-growing software companies in the world, serving more than 120,000 businesses, across a wide range of industries including trucking and logistics, construction, oil and gas, food and beverage, field service, agriculture, passenger transit, and delivery.Motive is built on four foundational attributes; Own It, Less but Better, Build Trust, and Unlock Potential. This has taken our company to great heights, including being recognized by Fortune for Best Workplaces, Forbes Best Startup Employers, and Comparably for our Best Global Culture, Sales Team, Leadership Team, Career Growth, and CEO for Diversity. We’re proud to receive an employee net promoter score of 63 (according to Comparably) which places Motive in the top 5% of companies with 4,000 employees or more.Today, our team is made up of more than 3,000 employees, located across the world, providing support to a wide range of customers. While most of our employees are remote, many have the opportunity to work on-site at any of our 8 global office locations. Visit our careers website to learn more about opportunities at Motive.About The RoleAs an SMB Outbound Account Executive, you’ll have the opportunity to work with our largest line of revenue. SMB customers operating 1-9 vehicles make up the majority of our customer base and are our largest revenue stream. We are looking for sales professionals who are competitive, driven, strong communicators, and consistently practice refining their skillset. You should be humble, coachable and relentless towards hitting your goals and targets.Learn more about our work culture and team members on this profile of our team here.What You'll Do High volume cold calling, prospecting new business and making outbound calls. You’re looking for the diamond in the rough, expect to have a high volume of outbound calls with a small number of qualified prospects responding. This is a cold-calling full-cycle sales role.Demo our software to prospective fleet managers and drivers.Survey prospects to understand pain points within their business so that you can align those business needs with the Motive solution.Educate fleet managers and drivers about Motive, understand their requirements, and help them get started with Motive.Maintain a consistent pipeline of qualified prospects and provide accurate forecasts for revenue.Achieve daily KPIs and monthly quota.
What We're Looking For Minimum of 1 to 2 years of outbound sales experience preferably with international clients (US/Canada/UK)Strong end-to-end ownership attitude from prospecting, demonstrations, to closing.Must be a self-starter, who empowers themselves and others to learn in a quickly evolving environment.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to successfully convey key value propositions and quickly manage objectionsAbility to multitask in a fast-paced environment.Experience with Salesforce, G-suite, MS Office tools, and general technical aptitude preferred.
Creating a diverse and inclusive workplace is one of Motive's core values. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Please review our Candidate Privacy Notice here.The applicant must be authorized to receive and access those commodities and technologies controlled under U.S. Export Administration Regulations. It is Motive's policy to require that employees be authorized to receive access to Motive products and technology.

About the job
            

 
Job title: Senior Software EngineerLocation: Lahore, Barcelona, Madrid, MumbaiAbout GelatoGelato has built the world's largest and most global platform for on-demand production and fulfillment of customized products. Today, those products are part of huge markets, such as apparel, wall-art, drinkware, digitally printed books, greeting cards. In the future, the market opportunities are endless thanks to new technologies such as 3D printing. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs and the global shift towards local and more sustainable production.Gelato TechnologyWe own no physical production assets, nor servers, instead our asset is a cloud based connectivity platform that enables world-class on-demand production for e-commerce platforms and applications. This engineered platform needs to provide our customers access to more than 130 production partners in 32 countries and includes production plate design, routing to an appropriate partner, finally linking to logistics’ systems for delivery to the consumer. All this in 72 hours and reaching more than 5 billion people and potential consumers in a smarter, faster, and greener way.The employed technologies range from backends using PHP and GoLang to mobile apps built natively or with hybrid technology, running on cloud services and with a modern CI/CD pipeline. Designing highly-available, fault-tolerant, cost-effective, scalable systems is our passion. We are using TDD, BDD, DDD principles and patterns, and agile methodology. Designing public API for millions of people, integrating with world-class third-party systems, and solving complex engineering problems (Graph, CAP, etc) are only a small glimpse into the tasks.What you will be doing Using the latest technologies to solve real problems for our customers at a massive scaleCollaborating closely with other engineers as a valuable member of a cross-functional teamSharing your knowledge and building creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practicesDesigning, developing, and deploying backend services with a focus on high availability, low latency, and scalabilityTaking end-to-end responsibility for the services that are owned by your team, including taking part in an on-call rotation
Who you are A programming language agnostic having 5+ years of experience in a similar roleHaving a minimum of B.S. degree in Information Technology or Computer SciencesAble to adapt, change and grow quickly as we scale the organizationPassionate about engineering practices like agile, continuous delivery, test-driven development, traceability, and observabilityGrowth mentality, are curious and not afraid to be experimental.You share your ideas and continuously improve yourself and the team around youSolid experience as an Engineer designing, developing, and maintaining API driven solutionsStrong communication skills, high integrity, and great attention to detail
Possess knowledge and experience, or have an interest in working with: Docker and KubernetesGoLang (Go-kit, DDD) + PHP (Symfony) good to haveMicroservices architecturePostgreSQL, BigQuery, RabbitMQMemcache, RedisELK, DataDog, Prometheus & Grafana
What we offerWe offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.Some of the highlights of the package include: Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvementChance to become a shareholder of Gelato!Flexible holidays, swap days off according to your values, beliefs and needs.Get paid in international currencyAnd much much more!
As we continue to grow we want you to grow with us and for the right candidate, there is no limit to where this opportunity might take you. Together we can increase global GDP by effectively supporting local sustainable on-demand production.

About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?At Trilogy, we see generative AI as more than a trend; we consider it the future scaffold of efficient software engineering. We see tools like Copilot, Cursor, and Code Interpreter as game-changers in the software industry, much like the Internet and cloud computing once were. If you're a seasoned software engineer with a keen interest in AI technologies, this role offers you a unique opportunity to blend your skills in both domains.Unlike many companies that only scratch the surface of AI's potential, Trilogy places a strong emphasis on the practical integration of generative AI into our engineering processes. Our methods aim for quick and tangible results, focusing on reusing and fine-tuning existing AI models to improve engineering outcomes.The primary responsibility in this position would be to develop a framework that effectively leverages AI tools within our engineering process. You'll propose and conduct experiments with generative AI to optimize problem-solving, solution design, and code generation. Additionally, you'll document these best practices in playbooks that will serve as invaluable resources for other engineering teams.You will adopt, test, and aggressively integrate new technologies, ultimately standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity, allowing our engineers to concentrate on essential decision-making.If this sounds like the challenge you've been waiting for, apply now to be a part of our transformative journey!What You Will Be Doing Leading initiatives and experiments using generative AI to improve engineering processes such as code generation, problem decomposition, and troubleshootingDocumenting and continually refining guidelines that set the standard for how generative AI should be used in software engineeringTaking on the development of fully functional features, using AI tools to expedite delivery and enhance quality
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models; instead, you will focus on using and/or fine-tuning existing modelsBeing confined to outdated technologies or a static tech stack that hinders innovation
Artificial Intelligence Engineer Key Responsibilities Establishing frameworks that integrate generative AI into our engineering processes to significantly boost productivity
Basic Requirements Minimum 5 years of experience in software developmentMinimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software productExtensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

About the Company: ConnectX is a dynamic startup established to serve property management companies in the UK. Our mission is to address the specific need for skilled property managers in the UK and empower individuals with rigorous training in property management, UK work ethics, culture, and problem-solving, bridging the gap between talent and industry demands. With our dedicated team of representatives experienced in remote property management for UK companies, we provide specialized professionals who excel in the dynamic property management landscape. Join us at ConnectX to be a part of our exciting journey, where you will have the opportunity to actively contribute to our operations and make a meaningful impact. As a startup, we value innovation, initiative, and a passion for hands-on work. If you thrive in a challenging yet rewarding environment, we look forward to hearing from you.JOB SUMMARY: As a Content Writing Expert at ConnectX, you will play a crucial role in creating and optimizing content that drives engagement, educates our audience, and enhances our online presence. You will work closely with our management to develop compelling and relevant content (both written and video/photographic) across various platforms, including our website, blog, social media, YouTube channel, and more. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Content Creation: Develop high-quality, well-researched, and engaging content that aligns with our brand's voice and messaging.Content Strategy: Collaborate with the marketing team to plan and execute content strategies that support our business goals and improve our online visibility.Research: Conduct in-depth research on industry trends, target audience preferences, and competitor content to create data-driven, informative content.Editing and Proofreading: Review and edit content for grammar, style, and accuracy to maintain consistent quality and brand standards.SEO Optimization: Optimize content for search engines to increase organic traffic and visibility. Familiarity with SEO best practices is a plus.Content Distribution: Assist in content distribution and promotion strategies to maximize the reach of our content.Content Calendar: Contribute to the development and management of the content calendar to ensure a consistent and cohesive content schedule.Performance Analysis: Monitor and analyze the performance of content using analytics tools to make data-driven improvements.Staying Current: Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in content marketing and SEO to continuously enhance our content strategy.
Qualification & Experience: Minimum Bachelors in Marketing or related degree Competencies: • Proficient in SEO, • Strong ability to use Ad Manager• Proven track record of running digital media campaigns • Attention to detail and accuracy• Strong Communication SkillsHours & Commitment: This is a full-time position and selected candidates will be required to work according to UK timings – 9 am to 6 pm (UTC+1) Additionally, the candidate will need to be flexible to travel to the UK as needed for client meetings and business development activities.All employees are required to pass ARLA exam to ensure their knowledge of the product.All employees are required to be able to demonstrate self-learning and problem-solving skills.

You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders to ensure the platform's efficiency, data accuracy, and alignment with business processes.About The TeamYou will get to be part of a dynamic and autonomous team from Careem veterans to new tigers who joined on a mission to build Careem Food all aligned on the same values of ownership, shooting to the moon and being of service to customers, partners, colleagues and captains.What You'll DoSalesforce Configuration and Maintenance: Customize and configure Salesforce to meet the needs of our sales and account management teams.Maintain user roles, profiles, and security settings.Create and manage fields, page layouts, record types, and workflow rules.Monitor and resolve platform-related issues and user inquiries.
Data Management Ensure data integrity and cleanliness within the Salesforce platform.Import, export, and manipulate data as needed.Implement data deduplication and cleansing strategies.Collaborate with stakeholders to define data requirements and reports.
User Training And Support Provide training and support to Salesforce users, addressing their questions and concerns.Assist in onboarding new users and helping them become proficient with the platform.Develop and maintain documentation and training materials.
Integration And Automation Integrate Salesforce with other systems and applications as required.Implement automation processes using Salesforce tools like Process Builder and Flow.
Reporting And Analytics Create and maintain reports and dashboards to provide insights into sales and customer service performance.Collaborate with business analysts to define reporting requirements.
Continuous Improvement Stay up-to-date with Salesforce best practices, updates, and new features.Propose and implement enhancements to the Salesforce platform to improve efficiency and user experience.
Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.Salesforce Administrator certification (ADM201 or higher) is preferred.Proven experience as a Salesforce Administrator, preferably in a high-volume, dynamic environment.Strong understanding of Salesforce architecture, data model, and security model.Proficiency in Salesforce Lightning, Salesforce CPQ, and other related tools.Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.Strong communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment.Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
What You'll Need 3+ years of previous experience Excellent attention to detail, people skills and organization skillsStrong problem solving skills and comfortable analyzing dataHighly proficient in Salesforce and Microsoft Office tools and related project/program management applications
What We’ll Provide YouWe offer colleagues the opportunity to drive impact in the region while they learn and grow. As a Careem colleague you will be able to:  Work and learn from great minds by joining a community of inspiring colleagues.  Put your passion to work in a purposeful organisation dedicated to creating impact in a region with a lot of untapped potential.  Explore new opportunities to learn and grow every day.  Enjoy the flexibility that comes with the trust of being an owner; work in a hybrid style with a mix of days at the office and at home, and remotely from any country in the world for 30 days a year with unlimited vacation days per year.  Access to healthcare benefits and fitness reimbursements for health activities including: gym, health club and training classes.

Additionally, you'll document these best practices in playbooks that will serve as invaluable resources for other engineering teams.You will adopt, test, and aggressively integrate new technologies, ultimately standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity, allowing our engineers to concentrate on essential decision-making.If this sounds like the challenge you've been waiting for, apply now to be a part of our transformative journey!What You Will Be Doing Leading initiatives and experiments using generative AI to improve engineering processes such as code generation, problem decomposition, and troubleshootingDocumenting and continually refining guidelines that set the standard for how generative AI should be used in software engineeringTaking on the development of fully functional features, using AI tools to expedite delivery and enhance quality

AI Super Engineer Key Responsibilities Establishing frameworks that integrate generative AI into our engineering processes to significantly boost productivity

Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled Project Manager – Agile PMO to join our dynamic and innovative team. The Project Manager - Agile PMO plays a crucial role in facilitating Agile practices and ensuring the successful execution of Agile projects within the organization. This role involves providing guidance, support, and governance to Agile teams while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and alignment with organizational goals. This role also involves defining and maintaining project management standards and processes, providing guidance and support to project teams, and ensuring the successful delivery of projects within scope, time, and budget constraints.  Responsibilities:  Lead the implementation and ongoing improvement of Agile methodologies, including Scrum, Kanban, or other frameworks. Define and maintain Agile processes, practices, and standards tailored to the organization's needs. Provide coaching and training to Agile teams, Scrum Masters, and Product Owners on Agile principles and practices. Support teams in adopting and adapting Agile methods to maximize their effectiveness. Establish key Agile performance metrics, KPIs and reporting mechanisms to assess project progress and team performance. Generate reports and dashboards to provide transparency and insights for stakeholders. Ensure adherence to Agile principles and organizational standards while balancing autonomy and self-organization within Agile teams. Implement and maintain governance practices to minimize risks and address impediments. Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize and manage the Agile project portfolio. Align Agile initiatives with the organization's strategic goals and objectives. Promote a culture of continuous improvement through regular retrospectives and Agile assessments. Identify opportunities for process enhancements and facilitate initiatives to implement changes. Foster collaboration and effective communication among Agile teams, stakeholders, and leadership. Serve as a point of contact for Agile-related inquiries and issue resolution. Define, maintain, and continuously improve project management standards, methodologies, and best practices. Monitor project progress and performance, identifying and addressing issues or deviations from the plan. Manage project portfolio, prioritize projects based on organizational goals, and allocate resources accordingly. Establish and enforce project governance structures. Prepare and present regular project status reports to stakeholders and executive leadership. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies. Optimize resource allocation across projects, balancing workload and capacity. Identify and manage project risks and issues, implementing mitigation strategies as needed. Conduct project audits and reviews to identify areas for improvement. Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, ensuring their expectations are met or exceeded. Serve as a point of contact for escalations and issue resolution related to projects. 
 Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in a related field (Master's degree preferred). Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), Professional Scrum Master (PSM) or equivalent Agile certification. Bonus if you also have Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent certification. Strong knowledge of Agile methodologies, principles, and frameworks. Excellent coaching and mentoring skills. Proficiency in Agile project management tools and software. Exceptional problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to adapt and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Excellent leadership and team management skills. Proficiency in project management software and tools. 
Perks and Benefits:  Competitive Salary Provident Fund Medical Allowances Professional Trainings Quarterly/Annual Performance Bonus and Awards Football, Ping Pong and Board Games Galore Company sports teams, game nights, dinners, trips Fun and dynamic working environment 
About Cinnova: Cinnova is an innovation-focused software development company helping startups and established firms with their MVPs, product design, and ongoing software development needs. With a proven track record of contributing to continuous growth, Cinnova has been part of rapid expansions and some great exits for our clients. From Blockchain technology to IoT development, AI, Machine Learning, and beyond, we have always been at the forefront of the technology landscape by bringing innovation to both startups and growth companies. Cinnova = (C)reativity + (innova)tion. This is our guiding principal both internally for our employees and externally for our customers. With that in mind, we promote a startup culture and encourage innovative ideas to incorporate in our delivery to our clients. This has been very successful as we are proud to have members who come from a startup background and continue to help Cinnova being an innovation hub.

Our methods aim for quick and tangible results, focusing on reusing and fine-tuning existing AI models to improve engineering outcomes.The primary responsibility in this position would be to develop a framework that effectively leverages AI tools within our engineering process. You'll propose and conduct experiments with generative AI to optimize problem-solving, solution design, and code generation. Additionally, you'll document these best practices in playbooks that will serve as invaluable resources for other engineering teams.You will adopt, test, and aggressively integrate new technologies, ultimately standardizing a tech stack that genuinely boosts productivity, allowing our engineers to concentrate on essential decision-making.If this sounds like the challenge you've been waiting for, apply now to be a part of our transformative journey!What You Will Be Doing Leading initiatives and experiments using generative AI to improve engineering processes such as code generation, problem decomposition, and troubleshootingDocumenting and continually refining guidelines that set the standard for how generative AI should be used in software engineeringTaking on the development of fully functional features, using AI tools to expedite delivery and enhance quality
What You Won’t Be Doing Developing completely new AI models; instead, you will focus on using and/or fine-tuning existing modelsBeing confined to outdated technologies or a static tech stack that hinders innovation
Senior AI Engineer Key Responsibilities Establishing frameworks that integrate generative AI into our engineering processes to significantly boost productivity
Basic Requirements Minimum 5 years of experience in software developmentMinimum 3 years as a primary technical contributor for a development team or software productExtensive hands-on experience using generative AI for software engineering tasks or in a product you built
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsDevelopment Team Lead key responsibilities At least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

About Us:At Centrox, we believe in the power of compelling content to engage, educate, and inspire our audience. We are a diverse company striving to innovate and solve interesting problems, and we are looking for a talented Content Marketing Specialist to join our team. If you have a passion for crafting meaningful content and a knack for driving results, we want to hear from you.Job Description:As a Content Marketing Specialist at Centrox, you will play a key role in developing and executing our content strategy. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to create, optimize, and distribute content that not only showcases our brand but also resonates with our target audience.Key Responsibilities: Develop and implement a comprehensive content marketing strategy that aligns with the company's goals and audience personas.Create a wide range of content, including shorts/stories, videos, social media posts, blog posts, articles, infographics, webinars, and more.Research and identify trending topics and keywords to guide content creation and SEO efforts.Collaborate with design and marketing people to create visually engaging content.Manage the content calendar and ensure timely publication of high-quality content.Optimize content for search engines (SEO) and monitor performance using analytics tools.Engage with subject matter experts to extract valuable insights and turn them into informative content pieces.Promote content through various channels, including email marketing, social media, and influencer outreach.Identify and reach out to industry influencers and potential content partners for co-marketing opportunities.Monitor and report on content performance and adjust strategies to improve engagement and conversion rates.Stay updated on industry trends, content marketing best practices, and emerging tools to maintain a competitive edge.
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Mass Communications, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).Proven experience in content marketing, with a strong portfolio showcasing past work.Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a keen eye for grammar and style.Understanding of SEO, keyword research, and content optimization.Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and analytics tools.Creativity, strong critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for collaboration with cross-functional teams.Proficiency in using graphic design and video editing tools is a plus.Enthusiasm for staying current with content marketing trends and emerging platforms.
Benefits: Market Competitive Salary.Growth Incentives, Rewards and Cash Bonuses.A creative and collaborative work environment.Opportunities for professional development and training.
If you are a passionate content marketer with a talent for crafting stories that resonate with audiences and a desire to contribute to our company's success, we encourage you to apply and join our innovative team. Centrox is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Location: Gulberg Greens, Islamabad

About the job
            

 
Product Owners are the heart of Technology Product Management. You will have an opportunity to manage the development of different products from idea to delivery to ensure they meet the business needs and preferences. Your main duties include determining the overall vision of products, managing various backlog items, and deciding which features each product will have according to a client’s preferences.Responsibilities:1- Project Clarification, requirement gathering, and availability Requirement gathering and collaboration with the client Documenting gathered requirements into a backlog as well-defined user stories Extracting granular, track-able requirement pieces that can be closed within an iteration Supervising defect reporting and fixing Updating requirement completion progress in the tracking system In collaboration with stakeholders defining product goals, product roadmap, and release plans Works with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders, including cloud, database, analytics, design/user experience, engineering, and user enablement. 
2- Product backlog management Managing and taking complete ownership of product backlog and helping with a sprint backlog Providing a healthy feature/project delivery forecast by involving the team to get an estimation of the backlog Ensuring a well-groomed product backlog for at least two months in advance Entering requirements into a tracking system (JIRA, TFS, etc.) Supervising support ticket reporting and handling Ensuring client responsiveness within 24 hours Ensuring good customer representation in the Scrum team Ensuring quality of ‘Definition of Done’ according to the clients requirements and organizational standards Excellent grasp of Agile and Scrum principles and practices 
3- Project/Task reviews Ensure an eye for detail (Grammatical, presentation issues, etc.) in the task and project reviews Participation in sprint review meetings and sprint planning. Ensuring minutes of meetings are sent to all the stakeholders and concerned employees Complete requirements: Reviewing and ensuring that client expectations are met by doing internal UATs of the stories 
Requirements: Advanced knowledge of agile and scrum methodologies 5 years of relevant experience.

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.
What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!What You Will Be Doing Building modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic RequirementsFull Stack Developer key responsibilities At least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
